Sequence Information.Peptide Name: cd4(Q5K,D9K) (cyclic dimeric KR-12, synthetic AMPs, UCBB1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (87.5%) tocd4K: 25%, R: 19%, I: 13%, G: 19%.Activity:  active against E. coli (MIC 0.625 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.625 uM), S. aureus (MIC 0.625  uM), and C. albicans (MIC 1.25  uM). Warning: Non-standard assay.In vitro toxicity: human RBC, HC50 10 uM, hemolytic.Peptide stability: over 50% remaining in 25% serum after 6 h.Structure:  random coil in buffer and helical in lysophosphatidylglycerol.
Literature Information.Author: Gunasekera S, Muhammad T, Strömstedt AA, Rosengren KJ, Göransson U.2020
Literature Information.Title: Backbone Cyclization and Dimerization of LL-37-Derived Peptides Enhance Antimicrobial Activity and Proteolytic Stability.
